SENT.plain: In 1984-1989 at the First Paediatric Clinic of the Motol Faculty Hospital six patients with the diagnosis of infantile cortical hyperostosis (Caffey-Silvermann syndrome) were hospitalized
Non-familial concurrence of the disease was involved
All children developed the disease before the age of 4.5 months, four before the age of three months
Among the six patients was only one girl
As to pathological findings there was a markedly elevated FW in 5/6, leucocytosis in 5/6, thrombocytosis in 3/4, eosinophilia in 3/6, elevated alkaline phosphatases in 2/6
The affection was four times on the mandible, once in the area of the hip joints and in one instance it was multifocal
The authors present one detailed case-history with extreme affection of the clavicle which was originally taken for a bone tumour
